title.narrative: Greenhouse Development in Severynivka, Zhmerynka raion, Vinnytsia oblast

description.narrative: rowing organic greenhouse products is a new approach for the Ukrainian agricultural sector, with great potential for generating additional income and substantially improving diets. Within the framework of this project, the “Severyn” Agricultural Service Cooperative (ASC) in Severynivka village will use innovative technology to grow greenhouse products, with the goal of improving the productivity of its greenhouses, thereby increasing project profitability, while shortening the payback period. The activities of the ASC will make a substantial contribution to the development of the community and the village of Severynikva, which has a high unemployment rate. The greenhouse complex of “Severyn” ASC , which will grow organic agricultural products and flowers and supply them to markets across Vinnytsia oblast, is the first such enterprise in Zhmerynka raion. The greenhouse complex will provide employment opportunities to 120 families, who will be engaged in growing produce using environmentally-clean thermal energy. The project will help alleviate social issues in the village, including reducing the unemployment rate, improving the well-being of rural residents (increasing income by an expected minimum of 25 percent), supplying the region with organic produce and flowers and providing experience and work opportunities for the youth who will be assisting with the implementation of the project. This project also includes the development and application of new agroecological practices. As with many other Heifer-Ukraine projects, the Severynikva community plans to use the surplus income generated from the project to fund various social projects within the village, such as constructing kindergartens and renovating children’s clubs.
